intro: Mosiera cabanasensis subsp. flavicans, commonly known as the yellow-flowered mosiera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The species is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
